boundary

Class GUIBoundary

  • java.lang.Object
    • boundary.GUIBoundary

  • public class GUIBoundary
extends java.lang.Object
    Includes all connections between the GUI.jar and the program. Methods made static to avoid having to make a new object, in classes which need to use one method. Description for methods, where other isn't stated, is taken from the GUI.jar javadoc. Made by Ronnie Dalsgaard. Parameters description is not made by Ronnie Dalsgaard.
    Author:
    Bjarke

    • Method Detail

      • createBoard

        public static void createBoard(Board board)
        Initializes the board using an array. Doesn't show the GUI. If this method isn't the first method to be called it will have no result.
        Parameters:
        board - TUI-based board.

      • showMessage

        public static void showMessage(java.lang.String string)
        Displays a message to the user. Breaks the system until "OK" is pressed.
        Parameters:
        string - The string to be displayed.

      • getUserInteger

        public static int getUserInteger(java.lang.String string,
                                 int min,
                                 int max)
        Displays a message to the user and awaits the integer response.
        Parameters:
        string - The string to be displayed.
        min - The minimum of the integer to return.
        max - The maximum of the integer to return.
        Returns:

      • getUserButtonPressed

        public static java.lang.String getUserButtonPressed(java.lang.String msg,
                                                    java.lang.String... buttons)
        Displays a message to the user and awaits the button pressed response.
        Parameters:
        msg - The Message to be displayed.
        buttons - The options the user have.
        Returns:

      • getUserLeftButtonPressed

        public static boolean getUserLeftButtonPressed(java.lang.String msg,
                                               java.lang.String trueButton,
                                               java.lang.String falseButton)
        Displays a message to the user and awaits the boolean response.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to be displayed.
        trueButton - First option the user can choose - Returns true.
        falseButton - Second option the user can choose - Returns false.
        Returns:

        Displays a message to the user and awaits the response.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • addPlayer

        public static void addPlayer(User user)
        Adds a player to the board. Using the method setCar.
        Parameters:
        user - The user which the method needs to use.

      • setOwner

        public static void setOwner(int fieldNumber,
                            java.lang.String name)
        Sets an owner of a field. The field border will have the same color as the player.
        Parameters:
        fieldNumber - The field number where the owner should be set.
        name - The name that needs to be set as owner.

      • removeOwner

        public static void removeOwner(int fieldNumber)
        Removes an owner from the field. If the field has no owner, nothing happends.
        Parameters:
        fieldNumber - Field number of the field where a owner needs to be removed.

      • setBalance

        public static void setBalance(java.lang.String name,
                              int newBalance)
        Sets the balance of a player if the player has been added.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the player who balances needs to be set.
        newBalance - The balance of the player.

      • removeCar

        public static void removeCar(int fieldNumber,
                             java.lang.String name)
        Removes a car from the board. If the car is not on the board, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        fieldNumber - The field number where a car needs to be removed from.
        name - The name of the car which needs to be removed.

      • setCar

        public static void setCar(int fieldNumber,
                          java.lang.String name)
        removeAllCars: Removes all cars belonging to the player. setCar: Places a car on the Field. All cars can be placed on the same field. A car can only be placed if the corresponding player has been added. If a car is placed on the same field multiple times, nothing more happens. A car can not be placed on multiple fields simultaneously.
        Parameters:
        fieldNumber - The field number where the car needs to be set.
        name - The name of driver.

      • setDice

        public static void setDice(int faceValue1,
                           int faceValue2)
        Shows two dice on the board.
        Parameters:
        faceValue1 - What the first dice need to show.
        faceValue2 - What the second dice need to show.

      • setHouses

        public static void setHouses(int fieldNumber,
                             int houseCount)
        Sets houses from the street, and removes the hotel if one is present. If houseCount is out of bounds, nothing happens. If field is not a street, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        fieldNumber - The field number of the street where the house should be placed.
        houseCount - The number of houses that should be shown on the street.

      • setHotel

        public static void setHotel(int fieldNumber,
                            boolean hasHotel)
        Sets whether or not a hotel should be on the street and removes all houses is any is present.
        Parameters:
        fieldNumber - The field number of the street where the hotel should be placed.
        hasHotel - If true places a hotel, if false does not.
